answers.answer: Hi!Neuropathy is a type of damage to a nerve. Palsy means weakness or absence of function of muscles due to this nerve damage. So this condition could be peripheral (peripheral neuropathy or damage of nerves other than brain and spinal cord) as seen in diabetes, hypothyroidism, Lyme’s, lupus, and metal toxicities.The other possibility is that the neuropathy is central (central neuropathy). This happens due to damage of portions of neurons in brain and spinal cord. This can happen due to multiple sclerosis, ischemia in brain, stroke, tumor, benign intracranial hypertension etc.Depending on your symptoms your neurologist decides whether you have a peripheral or a central neuropathy. Further tests are then conducted to find the cause. Do discuss this with your doctor. Take care!
